subject: Programming
title: The Goto Debate
description: A fast breakdown of The Goto Debate for builders.

hook.text: In 1968, Edsger Dijkstra published a letter that ignited the fiercest debate in programming.

buildup.text: His paper 'Go To Statement Considered Harmful' attacked the most common tool in every codebase.

discovery.text: Goto let code jump anywhere, creating tangled paths nearly impossible to debug.

twist.text: Many programmers fought back. Goto was fast and flexible â€” structure felt like a straitjacket.

climax.text: Dijkstra won. Structured loops and functions replaced goto in almost every modern language.

punchline.text: One letter rewired how the world writes code.
